Text:
Get vaccinated!

These shots need to get into arms as rapidly as possible, or else we're gonna be back in a situation this fall like what we went through last year. https://t.co/J4o6yL5cn4

Glad that @usedgov listened to Senate Republicans and many, many Americans and is shelving plans to let divisive, debunked propaganda take over programs for promoting civics. Students deserve a rich, rigorous education in civics and our nation’s history. My full statement: https://t.co/VuyAzNrbzx

The American people believe it should be easy to vote and hard to cheat. 

Why are Democratic politicians so panicked over modest and popular ballot integrity measures like voter ID, paired with lots of early voting and flexibility? 
https://t.co/0aNVt5g0uP

Democrats have abandoned a 40-year-old bipartisan consensus on the Hyde Amendment.

Republicans will continue standing up for life, taxpayers, and for the conscience rights of the majority of Americans who don’t want the government laundering their money to abortion providers. https://t.co/SlcUsNaI8t

On Democrats’ watch, inflation has turned a 3.5% annual pay raise for American workers into a nearly 2% pay cut.

Families are facing runaway costs.

But Democrats still want to tax, borrow, and spend another $4 trillion this summer. https://t.co/TwhAP8IwFb

The brave men and women taking to the streets in Cuba are demanding freedoms they’ve been denied all their lives. From Miami to Louisville, Cuban Americans are keeping the faith with brave protestors demanding an end to the failed regime's injustices. They deserve our support. https://t.co/fzSamCO7SQ
Tune in now to @FoxNews: I am joining @HARRISFAULKNER to discuss Cuba, the Biden Administration’s inflation crisis, and the Democrats' partisan election power grab.

Americans believe it should be easy to vote & hard to cheat.

Americans believe in both early voting & voter ID.

Americans know it is not an assault on democracy to wind down emergency COVID measures like allowing early voting in the dead of night. 

https://t.co/xXicmLjsuw

Fascinating to see U.S. Senate Democrats very interested in the legislative minority rights of Texas Senate Democrats while they keep clamoring to steamroll our own Senate rules and seize total power for themselves. https://t.co/Ta7gWst6z2

The Biden Administration is desperate to duck hard questions about its retreat from Afghanistan. The American people deserve to know how the President plans to keep them safe against a terrorist enemy that his own senior advisors admit will now be allowed to regroup. https://t.co/ZjJRPY8xo4

Republicans and economists all warned that Democrats’ last massive spending spree would hurt Americans. Sure enough — runaway inflation. And they want an even bigger socialist sequel this summer?
https://t.co/ezHZTInvA6

Cuba’s brutal socialist regime has stolen the dreams of millions of innocent people.

From Miami to Louisville, Cuban Americans are keeping the faith with brave protestors demanding an end to the regime's injustices. America must stand with them.
I agree with @ChuckGrassley. This removal would be an unprecedented and dangerous politicization of the Social Security Administration. https://t.co/Y33G4YoZKf

In spite of experts’ warnings, Democrats’ latest massive spending bill created conditions that have kept too many Americans out of the job market. The government should not be paying more for workers to stay home than to go to work. https://t.co/CaeWjsJdSF

America is in the red zone of the fight against COVID-19, but we're not yet in the end zone. 
 
Everyone who is able should get vaccinated. We need to finish the job. https://t.co/4QLeu48E1i

As we celebrate Independence Day, let’s all give thanks for the brave Americans, and Kentuckians, who have served and sacrificed to preserve our sacred liberties.
 
And, let’s never forget how incredibly blessed we are to be Americans.
 
Happy Fourth of July! https://t.co/QKql35f17u

Today, the Supreme Court upheld critical protections of representative government. These rulings are a warning to anyone still hoping to codify intimidation, protect themselves from voters, or otherwise tip the scales of our electoral system. My full statement: https://t.co/bzbBI31dV7

In Donald Rumsfeld, our nation has lost one of its fiercest defenders. Today, the Senate’s deepest sympathies are with Joyce and the entire family, who have lost a beloved husband, father, and role model. My full statement: https://t.co/cLi7FcevSB
Left, right and center, experts predicted Democrats' absurdly overpriced COVID package would damage our economy. Current inflation shows they were right. https://t.co/LwjFVwbT6F

As a polio survivor, I know how important an effective vaccine can be. It is a modern medical miracle that we were able to develop multiple effective vaccines in under a year. I continue to encourage everyone to get vaccinated. https://t.co/5dKO46lZ75

Republicans have been negotiating in bipartisan good faith to meet the real infrastructure needs of our nation. The President cannot let congressional Democrats hold a bipartisan bill hostage over a separate and partisan process. https://t.co/oN6ZY48wp3
Democrats have wanted to take over the entire federal election system for partisan advantage for years. But this week, the Senate rejected S. 1, their plan to do just that. https://t.co/ATkVZEHGsa
Tune in now to @FoxNews. I am joining @MikeEmanuelFox to discuss infrastructure negotiations and Democrats' designed-to-fail agenda.

Less than two hours after publicly endorsing our colleagues’ bipartisan agreement on infrastructure, the President took the extraordinary step of threatening to veto it. That’s not the way to show you’re serious about getting a bipartisan outcome. https://t.co/X19VKDAoul

I was honored to help welcome President Ghani to the Capitol. As the people of Afghanistan know best, the shared threats we face from terrorism and tyranny have not been defeated. My full statement: https://t.co/fLq7pap5Hj https://t.co/SesJbePDIs
Tune in now to the @GuyBensonShow. I will be discussing infrastructure, the border crisis, and Democrats' failed elections power-grab. https://t.co/HC2JtVXHgB

There is no coherent rationale for a federal takeover of elections in all 50 states. 

Today, the Senate will put an end to Democrats’ attempted power grab, S. 1. https://t.co/e4UCPnNgrB
The rotten inner workings of Democrats' S.1 power grab have been thoroughly exposed to the light. Whichever label Democrats slap on their bill, the substance remains the same. https://t.co/1mU9ghcajr

No matter which way Democrats sell their elections power-grab, reality doesn’t change: It’s always been a plan to rewrite the ground rules of American politics. And today, the Senate will reject it. https://t.co/SWpQr1wicO

There’s no rational basis for a federal government takeover of all 50 states’ elections.

For years, Democrats have been selling a partisan power grab. So far, the only thing bipartisan about it has been the opposition. https://t.co/I2vk6Ywk3N

Democrats have made abundantly clear that the real driving force behind S. 1 is a desire to rig the rules of American elections permanently in Democrats’ favor. 
 
That’s why the Senate will give this disastrous proposal no quarter.
Democrats can change the packaging, but their plan for a power-grab of America’s electoral system is still rotten to the core. My full statement: https://t.co/HLRuDSZ3lS

The Biden Administration’s spending has raised prices and made it almost impossible to get people back to work. Small businesses in Kentucky, and across America, can’t compete with policies that encourage Americans to stay on the sidelines. https://t.co/1fckR0Lycb

Far too often, the federal government has proven incapable – or even unwilling – to protect taxpayers’ data from misuse by the political left. 

The latest IRS leak must be investigated thoroughly, and those responsible must face actual consequences.

Last week’s leak of IRS data was a reminder that bad actors are more than happy to weaponize Americans’ tax information for political purposes. Those responsible for these criminal disclosures should be punished as directed by law. Read our letter: https://t.co/dMjBFyqBje

On the 246th birthday of the @USArmy, we honor the brave men and women who have served and continue to serve our great nation. I’m particularly grateful to the soldiers who call @FortKnoxKY and @FortCampbell home. https://t.co/Udgy8TjLG0

After sending dangerous mixed messages from the campaign trail, this Administration has spent months focusing on what to call the border crisis instead of how to fix it. 

The origins of the crisis facing CBP and border communities are not a mystery.

Consumer prices are rising faster than they have since the depths of the 2008 recession.

The data reinforce what American families are experiencing firsthand: the Biden Administration’s partisan spending has blunted our nation’s economic recovery.
Tune in now to @FoxNews: I’m joining @DanaPerino and @BillHemmer to discuss the Democrats' designed-to-fail agenda and the ongoing crisis at our southern border.

The American people rightly expect a 50-50 Senate to find common ground on serious, mainstream action. This year, we’ve done so repeatedly.

But this month, Democrats have decided to instead appease their far-left fringe and put forward a partisan agenda that is designed to fail.

Senate Republicans have repeatedly proposed serious investments in roads, bridges, broadband, and other actual infrastructure Americans rely on.

But this week, the Biden Administration has shown it’s unwilling to let go of radical promises made to Democrats’ far-left base.

The American people expect a 50-50 Senate to spend its time finding common ground. Multiple times this year, we’ve come together to take bipartisan steps on serious issues. 

But this month, that’s coming to a screeching halt. Senate Democrats' June agenda is designed to fail. https://t.co/akbFIZaxR9

Democrats rammed through their spending bill in spite of warnings that it would slow rehiring and drive up prices for American families,  
 
As last month’s jobs report shows, the consequences for Main Street small businesses are coming into painful focus.

This Memorial Day we remember the brave men and women in uniform who have laid down their lives in defense of our nation. Let us carry their memory close today and honor their sacrifice always. https://t.co/CVIrVtbUjw

Military families make sacrifices alongside their relatives in uniform. The Gold Star Families Memorial in Owensboro, KY commemorates honors those whose loved ones have made the ultimate sacrifice. This Memorial Day weekend, we keep these families in our prayers as well. https://t.co/jAzmcWyatF

Americans are already hurting from far-left economics that ignore reality. The Administration’s counterproductive ‘COVID relief bill’ has slowed rehiring. Families are facing painful inflation. And the Administration wants to triple down on the same mistakes?

So far the Biden Administration has recommended we spend $7 trillion additional dollars this year.
 
That would be more than we spent during World War II. And Americans are already feeling the pinch. Democrats need to get their runaway spending habits under control. https://t.co/9jrktLW6Wc

President Biden’s proposal would drown American families in debt, deficits, and inflation.

My full statement: https://t.co/5mulxq0UwO

Republicans and liberal economists alike warned the Democrats’ $1.9 trillion so-called ‘COVID bill’ could cause inflation that would hurt ordinary American families.

Fast forward: We just got the most dramatic monthly inflation report in decades. https://t.co/K9ewBAqabG
Tune in now to @CNBC. I am joining @SquawkStreet to discuss how Democrats' hard left turn is already affecting the entire U.S. economy and hitting working American families where it hurts.

Today, one Senate committee unanimously backed a bipartisan infrastructure bill. Another deadlocked over a descendant of the Green New Deal.
 
This is choice before the Administration. Strong, lasting bipartisan cooperation on practical solutions — or go-it-alone partisanship.

Everyone from Republicans to liberal economists warned Democrats’ $1.9 trillion ‘COVID bill’ could risk inflation.

We just got the sharpest monthly inflation report in over a decade.

Ask a working American family about gas prices, food prices, lumber prices, housing prices.

The President’s rushed Afghanistan retreat is dangerous wishful thinking. Where will we base counterterrorism forces? How will we secure our Embassy? Support allies? What about women’s rights? Refugee flows?

Many crucial questions. No answers and no plan from the Administration.

.@SenTomCotton and I have new legislation to fight anti-Semitism and ensure the bigoted thugs attacking Jewish Americans face the full force of our justice system. It’s sad our bill is urgently necessary today, in 2021, but I am proud to stand with the Jewish community.

The threats posed by China’s growing strategic capabilities and influence are real. But there's robust debate about how to meet them. 

@POTUS has proposed to cut defense spending after inflation. But short-changing the U.S. military can’t be part of a serious China strategy.
Israel has been up against a terrorist organization that attacks innocent civilians. Hamas does not represent Palestinians. There is no moral equivalency here. https://t.co/anwWNUnQ3b

President Biden's plan to raise taxes would hit Americans at all income levels and slow the economy down to a crawl. It won't earn a single Republican vote. We're going to fight it the whole way. https://t.co/olQi1YK1uS

If there is truly broad, bipartisan support for taking our competition with China more seriously, there ought to be bipartisan support for robust defense funding to maintain our edge. All the ‘soft power’ in the world will only benefit us if we have the hard power to back it up.

Americans know what happens when the IRS is allowed to subject individuals to unequal scrutiny based on their politics. I was proud to work with @SenatorBraun on a bill that would stop bureaucrats from snooping on data they don’t need: https://t.co/H2mUjl2Mqz
Tune in now to @FoxBusiness. I'm joining @larry_kudlow to discuss infrastructure, jobs, and the economy.

I applaud @POTUS for signing the COVID-19 Hate Crimes Act into law. Recent increases in anti-Asian hate crimes are alarming. I’m proud the Senate took bipartisan action — and, as the proud husband of a remarkable Asian-American woman, I am especially glad this effort is now law.

The crisis at our nation’s southern border is growing. CBP issued their April numbers and encounters with illegal entrants were 3% higher than in March. 

The Biden Administration still won’t admit it, but the facts are clear.

Israel’s enemies are watching. Not just Hamas, but Hizballah, and Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps.

We can not send the signal that terrorist attacks on American allies will be met with mealy-mouthed attempts to blame both sides. https://t.co/1L54kFFTr1
There is no moral equivalency between Israel, our ally, and Hamas, a terrorist organization funded by Iran. https://t.co/v82OyMeUUz

The policies that we passed in March 2020 are not the policies we need in May 2021.
 
We are a reopening country flooded with vaccines. Record job openings. Democrats should not be taxing the Americans who are back at work to continue paying extra benefits to those staying home.

I'm a proud, steadfast supporter of Israel. The U.S. should stand closely with our friends.

President Biden must remain strong against the voices within his own party that want to create false equivalence between terrorists attacking Israel and the nation defending itself.

Iran is the most active state sponsor of terror in the world. The rockets raining down on Israel bear Iranian fingerprints. So do anti-American & anti-Arab attacks. The Administration must not reward this behavior by reducing sanctions or jumping back into a failed nuclear deal.

When Democrats forced through their partisan “COVID relief" bill, we said bad policies would slow rehiring and risk inflation.
- April came in about 800,000 new jobs below expectations

- Unemployment actually inched back up

- The biggest reported inflation jump in over a decade https://t.co/AQt8SQVbTH

Democrats’ S. 1 is a partisan effort to take over our elections: Partisan control of the FEC. Partisan rules for states. Public funds sent to partisan campaigns. 
 
There is nothing bipartisan about it. S. 1 would shatter confidence in our democracy. https://t.co/YRfMBCXPXo

As we observe National Police Week, I had the honor of welcoming members of Kentucky’s Fraternal Order of Police to the Capitol. Standing with law enforcement isn’t something we do one week a year. We need to back the blue all year round. https://t.co/DTYvPaIR0U

Appreciated meeting today with Foreign Minister @MarisePayne of Australia. We discussed our nations’ efforts to meet shared challenges, from China’s aggression to democracy in Burma and counterterrorism in Afghanistan. It was a good conversation with a great ally. https://t.co/Ien9Lv3sKD

Tune in now: I'm joining @BretBaier on @FoxNews to discuss the prospects for a real, bipartisan infrastructure bill and why Democrats' plan for a partisan takeover of our democracy failed in committee yesterday.

I had a productive meeting at the White House with President Biden and congressional leaders. There is a bipartisan desire to get an outcome on infrastructure. It will take a bipartisan process to get one. https://t.co/TAyE4D6uzM

Israel must know that their friends and allies in the United States stand with them.

We support Israel’s right to peace and security. We support their goal of restoring deterrence. The Administration must not relax our efforts to hold terrorists and their supporters to account.

Democrats’ election takeover bill would literally hand public money to political campaigns. I proposed an amendment to instead send that money to fight the opioid epidemic and fentanyl that kill Americans. Democrats blocked it and voted to send the cash to politicians instead. https://t.co/2oQsHVPaU0

Democrats want to rewrite the rules of our elections and restrict Americans’ free speech on a purely partisan basis.

Hard to imagine anything that would shatter public confidence in our democracy more dramatically than a transparent partisan power grab. https://t.co/bjrCh4tFeW

Vaccines are available nationwide. We have millions of unfilled job openings. It is not fair to keep taxing working Americans to continue paying an extra federal bonus to folks who continue to stay home. And it’s holding back our nation’s recovery.

Democrats’ partisan power-grab “election reform” bill is not about voting rights. It’s about letting Washington Democrats control the terms of political debate and all 50 states’ election laws.

Republicans will expose this attempted D.C. takeover in tomorrow’s hearing. https://t.co/Qv2FoAQEJK

.@RepAndyBarr and I introduced bipartisan legislation after last year’s @KentuckyDerby to preserve our Commonwealth's signature racing industry.

Now, Thoroughbred racing is well-positioned for the future. https://t.co/62WHO9DymH

As Kentuckians, Thoroughbred racing is practically in our bones. It’s who we are. We find our state’s unique history on the track and in the stables. Today, the best of the Bluegrass is on full display at the 147th running of the @KentuckyDerby. https://t.co/7MQSvmGkG7

A number of Senate Republicans wrote President Biden’s @USEdGov today opposing a new proposal to skew civics and U.S. history toward activist indoctrination that is designed to push Americans apart. Our kids deserve the best. 

Read our letter: https://t.co/1Mxr0LFVkp

President Biden hasn’t tried to do anything remotely moderate. He ran as a moderate, but everything he's recommended is far left. 
 
Think of it as the Biden bait-and-switch. Bernie Sanders is really happy. https://t.co/uEsDSF7Q6z

This Administration wants to raise taxes to nudge families toward the kinds of jobs Democrats want Americans to have, in the industries they want to exist, using the kinds of childcare they endorse. These plans aren’t about creating options; they’re imposing a vision.

.@SenatorTimScott is a brave, courageous, and inspirational leader. If you want to see the future, watch his great speech from last night. He laid out what the Republican Party today and tomorrow is going to look like. https://t.co/VYjr8uyv4C
Tune in to @FoxNews. I am joining @marthamaccallum to discuss the contrast between President Biden’s Joint Address and Senator Tim Scott’s Republican response.

Last night, President Biden talked about unity and togetherness. But he delivered a multi-trillion-dollar shopping list that was not even intended to earn bipartisan buy-in. A lengthy liberal daydream that would force American families’ lives into Washington Democrats’ mold.

I am so glad the nation heard @SenatorTimScott's outstanding Republican response to President Biden’s address. Republicans stand for the principles and policies that unite Americans and expand opportunity for working families. Not radical agendas designed to push us apart.

Republicans have responded to Democrats’ “infrastructure” bill with a smart proposal to meet real needs.
 
Roads. Bridges. Ports. Airports. Waterways. Broadband.
 
Are Democrats ready to work together? Or was “infrastructure” just wrapping paper for more gifts to the far left?

As a polio victim myself, I fully understand the significance of vaccines. After decades of research, polio vaccine trials began on this day in 1954. 

Now, we developed multiple COVID vaccines in under a year. We all need to receive this modern medical miracle. https://t.co/9l0nz70CMd

.@SenatorTimScott is not just one of the strongest leaders in the Senate. He is one of the most inspiring and unifying leaders in our nation. I'm glad he’ll be delivering the Republican Address following the President’s remarks on Wednesday.

This Administration’s zeal for costly climate policy at home is not matched by our biggest competitors. China’s share of emissions is nearly double ours. The Paris Agreement is largely toothless.

Democrats can kill U.S. jobs & industries with no real impact on global emissions.

Today, Senate Republicans introduced our framework to improve our nation's infrastructure. 

Americans need and deserve bipartisan infrastructure solutions. I hope Democrats will come to the table and work with us on a bipartisan path forward to strengthen our homeland.

The late Justice Ginsburg rejected the discredit concept of court-packing.

“If anything would make the Court appear partisan, it would be that.”

“Nine seems to be a good number.”

Justice Breyer just reaffirmed his own opposition. And the American people agree overwhelmingly.

A major theme of the Biden Administration has been false advertising: 

Last month, it was the multi-trillion-dollar “COVID relief” bill that spent only 1% on vaccines. 

Now it’s a multi-trillion-dollar “infrastructure” plan where roads and bridges are almost a rounding error.

The situation at our southern border: record arrivals of unaccompanied minors.
 
The White House’s response: police the terminology border officials are allowed to use to describe the crisis.
 
Not securing the border. Just woke proofreading, in a parody of left-wing governance.

Foreign fentanyl analogues from China and elsewhere are incredibly poisonous drugs that kill Americans.
 
They're currently classified as illegal controlled substances. But some Democrats want to let that status expire.
 
Absurd. We should make this permanent. It's a no-brainer.

China jails peaceful dissidents, saying “only patriots” should govern Hong Kong.
 
The real patriots are the peaceful activists they have jailed and the hundreds of thousands still carrying the torch for democracy.
 
The free world must have their backs.

Last year, @SenatorTimScott and Republicans tried to pass major legislation that would have expanded body cameras, discouraged chokeholds, increased transparency, and finally made lynching a federal crime.

Democrats filibustered the bill because it wasn’t anti-police enough.

We are returning a generation of heroes to the forefront of our national memory — and the center of our nation’s capital.
 
Thanks to the @WW1CC and all who have made the new National World War I Memorial possible. https://t.co/HnUgwmzULB

Proud to introduce the CAROL Act today, alongside @SenatorSinema, one of @RepAndyBarr’s friends. This important legislation is a fitting tribute to a wonderful Kentuckian. It embodies Carol’s lifetime of service to others. I look forward to its passage.
